name: Remove More Jump
author: Bj√∏rn Johansen

sections.description: Usually when you click a permalink (“read more”-link) to a post, the link contains a “#more-” at the end, making the browser jump down to the “readmore” mark. You might not want this behaviour, so this plugin removes the anchor from the link.
sections.installation:
1. Download and unzip plugin
  2. Upload the ‘remove-more-jump’ folder to the ‘/wp-content/plugins/’ directory,
  3. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress.
sections.faq:
Why would I want to remove the jump?

The user doesn’t see the title or the text (s)he just read. This can make the user confused over what actually happened and whether they are on the correct page.

short_description: Removes the anchor from the permalinks ("read more"-links), so you don't jump halfway down the page.
description: Usually when you click a permalink (“read more”-link) to a post, the link contains a “#more-” at the end, making the browser jump down to the “readmore” mark. You might not want this behaviour, so this plugin removes the anchor from the link.

screenshots.caption: Permalink ("read more"-link) without this plugin has the #more-5 anchor
Permalink ("read more"-link) with this plugin is clean without anchor
